docs.text: Home ¶ In Device Installation you will find guides on setting up RigCtrl device for the first time, updating, configuring Windows to work with RigCtrl and Claymore configurations. In Rig Management you will find guides on using RigCtrl in general, for example how to use groups to install and configure Claymore on multiple rigs, how to configure and adjust settings for each rig and managing rigs. In RigCtrl Reset you will find guides to wire your rigs with RigCtrl Reset device to reset or power on/off your rigs.

docs.text: Connect RigCtrl to your WiFi ¶ RigCtrl device needs couple of minutes to startup for the first time! From a mobile device or computer connect to RigCtrlSetup wireless On a mobile device tap on Sign In to network notification when it appears If you don't get the notification open http://192.168.4.1 in your browser Enter a name (which you will later use to get the local IP from ip.rigctrl.com ) Select your Wireless from the list and enter the password Be patient until RigCtrl appears online If RigCtrlSetup wireless gets online again, it usually means that the password you entered was incorrect. Repeat instructions from step 1. Open ip.rigctrl.com and enter the name you provided during step 5. It can take 1-2 minutes until the IP address apears Click on the IP address to continue with RigCtrl configuration Setup and update ¶ Create user Log in Enter your wallet If you have Premium subscription, enter email address and register to get Viber notifications Click on the link to get the code for Viber Enter credentials and information for Windows and Claymore Save Get latest updates and bug fixes by going to Updates in Menu After saving configuration and updating, RigCtrl will start scanning the network for rigs. This operation takes couple of minutes before rigs start appearing. Windows configuration ¶ In order for RigCtrl to be able to install and configure Claymore, change wallets, restart Claymore and Windows, the Windows needs to be configured as bellow: Download config.zip in every rig Extract the files by right clicking config.zip and click on Extract All... From the new Windows Explorer right click on config.bat and click on Run as administrator Enter information required by the script In RigCtrl enter Windows user and password Menu - Configuration - Windows configuration and save the changes Important Windows user and password must to be the same on every rig! Claymore configuration ¶ If you have completed Windows Configuration and have installed Claymore via RigCtrl, then you can skip this section. To allow RigCtrl to perform action, Claymore needs to be configured with the following parameters: Add -mport 3333 in your start.bat or config.txt Optionally you can add a password using -mpsw password Add -r -1 to disable Claymore watchdog to not conflict with Rigctrl Important Claymore port and password must to be the same on every rig! If you have choosen a different port than 3333 or password you have to update RigCtrl configuration. Menu - Configuration - Claymore Configuration and save the changes. SimpleMining configuration ¶ Login in SimpleMining.net Click on RigList -> OPTIONS: wallets -> Enter your wallet in Ethereum address ($walletETH) -> Click on Save all options and reload all rigs Click on Rig Groups Click Add group Select Claymore version (recommended latest) by clicking on Select miner Enter a group name, i.e. RigCtrlGroup In Miner OPTIONS enter you configuration and modify or add mport 3333 Optionally you can add a password using -mpsw password Example: epool eu1.ethermine.org:4444 -ewal $walletETH.$rigName -esm 0 -epsw x -allpools 1 -mport 3333 If you have entered your wallet in step 2. do not change $walletETH Click on RigList Select all rigs Click ASSIGN GROUP Select RigCtrlGroup (or name you entered in step 6.) and click Save. Enter the port and/or password in RigCtrl - Menu - Configuration - Claymore configuration and click save!

docs.text: Managing groups for installing and configuring Claymore ¶ RigCtrl Claymore operations are available only if Windows configuration guide is completed Usually the rigs share together most of the Claymore parameters like wallet, fan speed settings, pool, etc. You want to keeps those commong parameters in a group and use it in all or a group of rigs. RigCtrl has a default global group with predefined Claymore parameters that rigs will initially use To add a group click on + Enter group name Example Name could be a group for rigs with same cards RX580-8GB or RX570-4GBSapphire Enter wallet only if it's different from the wallet in gray (wallet in Configuration) or you want a group that will mine for another wallet In Claymore command enter the complete command (except wallet). Refer to Claymore documentation for available options. Default RigCtrl global command is -epool eu1.ethermine.org:4444 -cvddc 900 -cclock 1150 -mclock 2000 -tstop 85 -tt 60 -fanmin 35 -fanmax 100 -r -1 -mport 3333 If a rig has different mclock, cclock or cvddc than other rigs in the same group, they can be entered and overriden by entering those in the rig list. If a rig needs different commands other than overclocking then create a new group for that rig. Managing rigs ¶ To manage rigs click on Rig/Group list from the menu Add a rig by clicking on + or remove a rig with X Change rig name for easier identification Enter or adjust Min hashrate Minimal hashrate is the lower boundary where if rig drops below that hashrate RigCtrl acts and restarts Claymore, Windows or perform a reset to bring the rig to optimal hashrate. It is important to enter correct min hashrate to have RigCtrl help you the best way. Select reset Port where rig is connected to. If a rig doesn't have assigned port it is not possible to hard reset, power off or power on. Select appropriate group Monitoring If a rig has Monitor selected, RigCtrl will monitor the rig and automatically peform actions like Claymore/Windows restart or hard reset. Uncheck monitoring if you don't want RigCtrl to take actions on a rig. Monitoring can be turned on or off from the home page as well. Regardless of monitoring, manual actions can be pefromed from the home page. Installing and configuring Claymore ¶ Enter cvddc , mclock and/or cclock that are specific to a rig in respecive fields in the list Example A rig has different GPUs and require different clocks than in group. We enter the following: cvddc: 950 cclock: 1150,1150,1130,1120,1140,1050 mclock: 2050,2050,2000,1900,2040,2050 The final Claymore command will be the group's commands except the clocks entered in the rig. Click on green play button to install or update Claymore This action installs/updates, combines group parameters with rig's clock, configures Claymore and puts Claymore in Windows startup Claymore version is always the latest Click on refresh button to send new Claymore configuration if any of the global or rig parameters are changed. This action only changes the Claymore command Warning Save the changes before executing any of the actions Managing rigs from the home page ¶ On home page every rig has its own menu where you can manage and take different actions Click on three vertical dots to open rig menu Edit Rig - From this dialog you can change rig information, claymore configuration and perform various actions Teamviewer ID - appears only if Teamviewer is installed on rig (click to copy ID) Restart Claymore Monitor On/Off Windows Restart Windows Shutdown The commands below are ony available if a rig is connected to a RigCtrl Reset device and has a port assigned - Reset - Power off - Power on
docs.title: Management

docs.text: Connecting RigCtrl Reset device ¶ Get a long enough cable to cover the distance between RigCtrl Reset and each rig A great choice of cable is a UTP network cable with 4 pairs (for 4 rigs) like this: Extend the cable with the 2 pin jumper (which is used to connect to the rig's motherboard) Fasten one end of the cable on the device like in the picture Each port reset port has three connection, use only the connections (in green) as in the picture below Connect the 2 pin jumper on your motherboard panel in the On/Off pins Consult your motherboard manual to locate the correct On/Off pins Wires between Reset and motherboard do not have current so the coloring is not important Assigning a port to a rig Go to Rig/Group List in RigCtrl menu, in Rig List for the desired rig select the port from the dropdown where it is connected to, or From home page open rig menu, click on Edit Rig and select a port Attention If you have more than one RigCtrl Reset devices go to Advanced Settings menu, at the bottom of the page select correct the Number of RigCtrl Reset devices and save.
